page.title: 04HEDON'S INTERESTING FEATURES
page.content: In{Hedon}there are many historic buildings,including St. Augustines church.This is a Grade 1 listed building.The church was started in 1190 but was delayed in 1368 because of the Black Death.St. Augustines is known as the "King of Holderness"and is a large and impressive Norman church. Other historic buildings include the Painters Cottages founded by George Painter in 1562.They have both been modernised with a supply of fresh water and electricity.The Painters Cottages are in Souttergate,that is one of the oldest streets in{Hedon}and contains many other old houses.Between Souttergate and the Town Hall which was built in 1693 lies the picturesque Market Place with its cobble stones and small shops.All of these features lie in The Hedon Town Scheme.
